public class BasicPositionedTextTokenIterator
extends GenericTokenIterator<fr.lipn.nlptools.utils.misc.PositionedText>

This class implements GenericTokenIterator over PositionedText elements.

Constructor Detail

BasicPositionedTextTokenIterator

public BasicPositionedTextTokenIterator(org.apache.uima.jcas.JCas aJCas,
                                        org.apache.uima.jcas.tcas.Annotation range,
                                        boolean iterateSentences,
                                        int tokenType,
                                        int sentenceType,
                                        java.lang.String[] regexps,
                                        java.lang.String[] replaceWith,
                                        boolean threadSafe,
                                        org.apache.uima.cas.FSMatchConstraint sentenceConstraint,
                                        org.apache.uima.cas.FSMatchConstraint tokenConstraint)
Detailed constructor

Parameters:
aJCas -
range - if not null, the resulting iterator is a subiterator for this Annotation
tokenType - UIMA token type
sentenceType - UIMA sentence type
iterateSentences - use sentences boundaries: that means that the resulting iterator will only iterate over tokens that belong to some sentence (a subiterator is used), and that startSentence(Annotation) and endSentence(Annotation) will be called for each sentence.
regexps - if not null, an array of strings representing regular expressions to be applied to each token. This can be used to filter some characters. By default the matches are deleted (see below).
replaceWith - if not null, an array of strings that will be used to replace the matches corresponding to the regular expressions, instead of deleting them (e.g. whitespace chars or some special char).
